fact_check_explanation_title: Spirit of Brunel? Are we seeing a boom in transport investment?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The government claims that spending on the road and rail networks is at a historic high. The evidence behind the claims is patchy, however.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence that thousands of migrants are claiming sick pay while abroad
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Express has reported that thousands of migrants are taking holidays or working abroad while claiming sick pay from UK companies, but there doesn't seem to be any evidence for …

fact_check_explanation_title: Calling time? New data on pub closures
fact_check_explanation_summary: The BBC's today programme reported that 28 pubs were closing their doors every week. Unlike when we last looked at this figure, it accounts for your local 'closing' and 'opening' …

fact_check_explanation_title: The consequences of the plastic bag charge: a round-up of the papers' claims
fact_check_explanation_summary: It's been claimed the government's proposal for a 5p charge on plastic bags will reduce their use by 76%, and that if people switch to paper or reusable bags it …

fact_check_explanation_title: Communicating uncertainty in statistics: a good practice guide
fact_check_explanation_summary: The LSE has said of statistics: "if you can quantify the uncertainty … you have gone a long way towards understanding what is going on." Government statisticians have been thinking …

fact_check_explanation_title: Bad charts: Times has trouble with its times
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Times today carried an article on American military spending in Europe, but it was the accompanying graph showing the change in the number of US forces based in Europe …

fact_check_explanation_title: 28 bills lighter? Comparing the 'zombie parliament' to previous sessions
fact_check_explanation_summary: Analysis by the Institute for Government provides some more context to claims that Parliament has been passing fewer laws.

fact_check_explanation_title: Not all of 20,000 'complaints' received by universities were complaints
fact_check_explanation_summary: Reports that 20,000 complaints had been received have been challenged by one of the universities under the microscope.

fact_check_explanation_title: A bag full of the Queen's speech
fact_check_explanation_summary: A 5p charge on disposable bags was one of the measures widely expected in the Queen's speech at today's opening of Parliament. Do we use 8 billion of them a …

fact_check_explanation_title: Why we can't say for sure how many illegal immigrants are living in the UK
fact_check_explanation_summary: A couple of papers reported that this country is home to 800,000 illegal immigrants. Can we actually know how many are here?

fact_check_explanation_title: Tony Blair's EU speech: no link between immigration and jobs?
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Mail reported that the former PM claimed "mass immigration made no difference to the job prospects of unemployed Britons." This isn't what he said.

fact_check_explanation_title: UK law and the EU: new estimates from House of Commons Library
fact_check_explanation_summary: Nick Clegg claimed 7% of UK law was influenced by the EU. Nigel Farage claimed 75%. The House of Commons Library's verdict: neither of them is right.
